DT_Quests.quest_talktocahn_QuestDescription: I don't know how Dr. Cahn got up to the Control Center so fast, but it seems like he wants to talk.
DT_Quests.tutorial_entershack_QuestDescription: I just arrived as a new transfer from Springer Facility. They said I should 'head to the Shack'.
DT_Quests.quest_officepowercell_QuestDescription: I need Power Cells to operate the Forklift supporting the blast door to Manufacturing West. Maybe someone in the Office sector will know where to locate Power Cells.
DT_Quests.quest_cblock_01_QuestDescription: I need to access the Inner Wing containment blocks to find something useful towards getting that gunk off the Vacuum Chamber Door.
DT_Quests.tutorial_talktoguard_QuestDescription: I need to check in with the Guard at the front desk.
DT_Quests.tutorial_traptarget_QuestDescription: I need to craft a net and throw it on the dummy.
DT_Quests.tutorial_bandage_QuestDescription: I need to craft some bandages to stop this bleeding.
DT_Quests.tutorial_smashcrate_QuestDescription: I need to find something to smash the crate that's blocking the other end of the vent.
DT_Quests.tutorial_elevator_QuestDescription: I need to go through the gate and get in the elevator. There's a button to activate it.
DT_Quests.tutorial_stomppest_QuestDescription: I need to go up to the dummy and stomp on it.
DT_Quests.tutorial_redeployheater_QuestDescription: I need to package up this Heater, and then re-deploy it by the power socket, then build it... and then plug it in!
DT_Quests.tutorial_equiphardhat_QuestDescription: I need to put the hard hat on.
DT_Quests.quest_cafeteriadoor_QuestDescription: I should probably let Dr. Jager into the Cafeteria.
DT_Quests.tutorial_talktoguard2_QuestDescription: I should talk to the Guard standing by the hat rack.
DT_Quests.tutorial_gothroughvent_QuestDescription: I'm crawling through a vent. Seriously?
DT_Quests.tutorial_nextroom_QuestDescription: I'm done with this part, and need to head into the next room.
DT_Quests.quest_entersecurity_QuestDescription: If I can break into the Security Sector, I should be able to make my way to the Large Surface Elevator.
DT_Quests.quest_gothroughwarehouse_QuestDescriptio: If I can get through the Warehouse alive, it may take me to another part of the Labs ... hopefully.
DT_Quests.quest_gettothecommandcenter_QuestDescrip: If I can get to the Control Center, I can deactivate the turrets and free Dr. Cahn. Cahn believes Helmholtz Wing has the answer.
DT_Quests.quest_deactivateturrets_QuestDescription: If I can get to the Control Center, I can reset the security system, free Dr. Cahn and deactivate the turrets guarding the Containment Block.
DT_Quests.quest_opensilo3_QuestDescription: It seems the energy research team has taken Power Cells into Silo 3 and were using them for experiments.
DT_Quests.quest_evacuateoffices_QuestDescription: It seems the main way out of the Office Sector is through Manufacturing West.
DT_Quests.quest_FindtheBlacksmith_QuestDescription: Locate the Blacksmith for information about getting out of here.
DT_Quests.quest_gothroughwarehouse_QuestText: Make it through the Furniture Store
DT_Quests.quest_opensilo3_QuestText: Open Silo 3 to retrieve Power Cells
DT_Quests.tutorial_redeployheater_QuestText: Redeploy Heater and Plug It In
DT_Quests.tutorial_smashcrate_QuestText: Smash the crate with a Wrench
DT_Quests.quest_findblacksmith_QuestDescription: The Blacksmith can help make parts to fix the electron pumps, and overload the synchrotron.
DT_Quests.tutorial_headin_QuestDescription: The Guard told me to head downstairs to the elevator.
DT_Quests.quest_findanotherroute_QuestDescription: The Surface Tunnel is blocked, but Frake may know how to get out of here, if I can find her.
DT_Quests.quest_surfaceexit_QuestDescription: The Surface Tunnel is the main route for heavy traffic in and out of Manufacturing.
DT_Quests.tutorial_end_QuestDescription: The elevator to Residences is now opened up to me. Time to get to work!
DT_Quests.quest_enterMF_QuestDescription: There's a tunnel out of here located somewhere in Manufacturing Sector.
DT_Quests.tutorial_traptarget_QuestText: Trap the target with a Throw Net
DT_Quests.quest_activateMFforklift_QuestText: Use Power Cell to access Manufacturing Sector
DT_Quests.quest_openvacdoor_QuestDescription: Use chemicals from the 'Shroom' zone of Anteverse 2 to open the Vacuum Chamber door.
DT_Quests.quest_findofficer_QuestDescription: You need to find the Security Officer for your sector. They'll know what to do.

DT_SandboxOptions.PowerSocketsOffAtNight_DisplayDescriptio: By default, power in the Facility is shut off at night, including power sockets. By setting this value to false, the game will become much easier as things like Batteries will not be required. Setting this false may also be required if the Day Night Cycle is set to Night Only.
DT_SandboxOptions.AllowPagers_DisplayDescription: If false, Pagers will not be useable in inventory or via the emote wheel. Setting this to false will make it harder to find other players.
DT_SandboxOptions.AllowTransmog_DisplayDescription: If false, players will be unable to transmogrify their armor to look like other pieces of armor using a certain piece of base equipment. This will limit customization but will not allow players to disguise their equipment as different equipment.
DT_SandboxOptions.ShowDeathMessages_DisplayDescription: If false, players will not be notified when someone is killed by something.
DT_SandboxOptions.AllowRecipeSharing_DisplayDescription: If false, this will disable the ability to share item recipes with other players.
DT_SandboxOptions.LootRespawnEnabled_DisplayDescription: If true, resources will spontaneously respawn around the Facility. This will not respawn Furniture, however. This is a good setting for public servers, but can cause objects to intersect or float, and will make some resource gathering aspects of the game less important and very unbalanced.
DT_SandboxOptions.DisableResearchMinigame_DisplayDescripti: If true, this will remove the Research Minigames when unlocking new recipes and simply unlock the recipe right away.
DT_SandboxOptions.SinkRefillRate_DisplayDescription: In the world, sinks will passively refill over time, allowing players to drink from them. This value adjusts the time this takes. A higher value will make sinks refill more quickly, and a lower value will make them refill more slowly. Setting this value to zero will disable sink refill, making the game much more challenging.
DT_SandboxOptions.DayNightCycleSpeedMultiplier_DisplayDesc: Speed multiplier for the Day and Night cycle. A higher number will make clock time pass faster. This will NOT affect the speed of other cooldowns, respawn times, and so on.
DT_SandboxOptions.ItemWeightMultiplier_DisplayDescription: This is a multiplier affecting how heavy items are in your inventory. If an item normally weighs 5, a value of 2 would make that item weigh 10, or twice as heavy. If you want items to be lighter, set this value lower than 1.
DT_SandboxOptions.ItemDurabilityMultiplier_DisplayDescript: This is a multiplier for item durability. If an item normally has 10 Durability, a value of 2 would make that item have 20 Durability, or double durability. If you want items to break faster, set this value below 1.
DT_SandboxOptions.EnemyHealthMultiplier_DisplayDescription: This is a multiplier of enemy health. Lowering this value will make enemies easier to kill, and a higher value will mean enemies will take more damage to kill.
DT_SandboxOptions.ItemStackSizeMultiplier_DisplayDescripti: This is a multiplier of how many times you can stack items in an inventory slot. Items that are not stackable are excluded from this. If an item stacks to 5 by default, a value of 2 will allow the item to stack up to 10.
DT_SandboxOptions.DetectionSpeedMultiplier_DisplayDescript: This multiplier will determine how fast enemies detect players. If set above 1, enemies will detect players faster than normal.
DT_SandboxOptions.DayNightCycleState_DisplayDescription: This setting will allow you to disable the Day Night Cycle. Time will continue to pass as normal, but there will be no transition from day to night or night to day. As some things only happen during day or night, this may cause unforseen consequences, such as an inability to acquire certain items. Change at your own risk.
DT_SandboxOptions.RefrigerationEffectivenessMultiplier_Dis: This value determines how effective it is to refrigerate items. This also affects how effective hot items (e.g. a cup of coffee) maintain their heat if they prefer staying warm and are kept in a warm location.
DT_SandboxOptions.FoodSpoilSpeedMultiplier_DisplayDescript: This value determines how fast food spoils. By default, most food will eventually decay and turn into rotten food. You can slow, speed up, or stop this function entirely with these options.
DT_SandboxOptions.EnemySpawnRate_DisplayDescription: This value determines how frequently enemies respawn. A lower value will increase enemy respawn timers, whereas a higher value will cause enemies to respawn more quickly than normal.
DT_SandboxOptions.ContinenceSpeedMultiplier_DisplayDescrip: This value is a multiplier and determines how fast Continence drains. A higher number will mean players have to use the toilet more often.
DT_SandboxOptions.FatigueSpeedMultiplier_DisplayDescriptio: This value is a multiplier and determines how fast Fatigue increases. A higher number will mean players get sleepier more quickly.en.
DT_SandboxOptions.HungerSpeedMultiplier_DisplayDescription: This value is a multiplier and determines how fast Hunger increases. A higher number will mean players need to eat more often.
DT_SandboxOptions.ThirstSpeedMultiplier_DisplayDescription: This value is a multiplier and determines how fast Thirst increases. A higher number will mean players need to drink more often.
DT_SandboxOptions.PlayerXPGainMultiplier_DisplayDescriptio: This value is a multiplier and determines how fast XP is gained by players. Above 1 will cause XP to be gained at a higher rate, while below 1 will cause XP to be gained slower. Setting this to 0 will disable the ability for players to level up skills at all.
DT_SandboxOptions.EnemyPlayerDamageMultiplier_DisplayDescr: This value will determine how damaging enemies are, as a multiplier of their damage. The default value is tuned for a fair and balanced experience. Lowering this value will make survivability easier, raising this value will make combat more challenging and enemies more lethal.
DT_SandboxOptions.EnemyDeployableDamageMultiplier_DisplayD: This value will determine how much damage enemies do to deployables, as a multiplier of their damage. Setting this lower will make bases more impervious to enemy attacks. Setting this to zero may cause enemies to get stuck or be unable to threaten player bases properly.
DT_SandboxOptions.DamageToAlliesMultiplier_DisplayDescript: This value will determine how much damage players do to other players, as a proportion of normal damage. If a weapon deals 10 damage, a value of 10% will mean players receive 1 damage instead. If you want to allow players to engage in player vs. player combat, this value will need to be 100% or higher.
DT_SandboxOptions.DurabilityLossOnDeathMultiplier_DisplayD: This value will determine how much durability is lost on weapons and items in the player's inventory when respawning.
DT_SandboxOptions.DeathPenalties_DisplayDescription: This will determine what penalties the player receives for respawning after death (or by using the Unstick option.)
DT_SandboxOptions.FirstTimeStartingWeapon_DisplayDescripti: When spawning into the world for the first time, this is the weapon players will receive. This is in addition to starting items from their selected Job.
DT_SandboxOptions.GlobalRecipeUnlocks_DisplayDescription: When true, all players will share the same recipe list instead of unlocking recipes individually.

DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_eyefordetail_DisplayDescriptio: Items with durability crafted by you are constructed with extra durability.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_fastprepper_DisplayDescription: All cooking-related recipes take half the time to craft.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_fastfood_DisplayDescription: All food you place on a cooktop or in an oven cooks 25% faster.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_bonesetter_DisplayDescription: All splints heal bones faster when applied by you.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_lightspeed_DisplayDescription: Along with your passive gains, you sprint 5% faster overall.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_aimdownsights_DisplayDescripti: Alternate Fire while aiming with a ranged weapon will zoom your vision.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_battlecharge_DisplayDescriptio: Attacking with a blunt or heavy weapon during a sprint will result in a driving power attack.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_assassin_DisplayDescription: Attacks on unaware enemies always deal double damage, even when standing.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_superiorgains_DisplayDescripti: Due to your extreme strength training, all items in your inventory weigh 25% less.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_healthyhabits_DisplayDescripti: Eating raw plants gives you increased food and hydration values.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_nosurvivors_DisplayDescription: Enemies killed by your Sharp melee attacks will outright die when they otherwise might have gone DBNO.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_reflectivemantle_DisplayDescri: Enemies who contact you with melee attacks will have a 25% chance of having some of their damage reflected back at them.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_crusher_DisplayDescription: Enemies with resistance to Blunt... don't.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_terminalvelocity_DisplayDescri: Hitting enemies with a thrown weapon has a slightly increased chance to stagger large enemies, a high chance to stagger medium-sized enemies and always staggers small enemies.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_radremover_DisplayDescription: NEW RECIPE: Pentetic Acid Syringe, a syringe that prevents radiation buildup and removes existing radiation.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_entangled_DisplayDescription: Plants planted by you have this perk attributed to them. The more plants in an area, the less water each individual plant consumes.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_straightarrow_DisplayDescripti: Projectiles (like crossbow bolts) have a lower chance to break on impact.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_stoppingpower_DisplayDescripti: Projectiles and bullets fired from ranged weapons have a small chance to stun the target.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_groupeffort_DisplayDescription: Resting (sitting on chair or floor) within 8 meters of other resting scientists doubles the resting rate.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_squint_DisplayDescription: Secondary Fire while aiming with a ranged weapon will zoom your vision some.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_eviscerator_DisplayDescription: Slice through Sharp-resistant enemies as if they weren't resistance at all.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_boomstick_DisplayDescription: Smaller creatures have a chance to run in fear when you fire a loud weapon.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_looserounds_DisplayDescription: Sometimes you find a few spare rounds when reloading. You are also an expert at reloading, with a bit of flair too.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_servingseconds_DisplayDescript: Soups, pies and similar foods cooked by you have 2 extra portions in them.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_outofmyway_DisplayDescription: Sprinting ramps up to 15% bonus speed over 5 seconds. At max speed, you can stagger any medium-sized enemy if collided with and allowing you to move through them for 1 second. This removes your built up speed.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_castledoctrine_DisplayDescript: The cost of building fortifications, like barricades, walls, and ramps, is reduced by half.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_surpriseattack_DisplayDescript: The first attack on an idle or unaware enemy has a 25% chance to deal double damage.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_repairaccesscontainers_Display: The player can access nearby containers when repairing items from the Repair & Salvage Station.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_spontaneousfurniture_DisplayDe: The universe is a strange place and your meddling has certainly made it stranger. You have a chance to receive double furniture when successfully packaging an item that wasn't placed by you or a fellow scientist.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_hazyrecollection_DisplayDescri: Weapons thrown by you are highlighted to you for 30 seconds.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_tinkerer_DisplayDescription: When crafting throwables (such as grenades) you get 1 additional item.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_precisionengineering_DisplayDe: When crafting, you have a small chance to use 1 less item when a recipe calls for more than 1 of the item.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_razedwithcare_DisplayDescripti: When dismantling furniture with a hammer, you have a 50% chance to receive double resources.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_prudentplucking_DisplayDescrip: When harvesting wild plants you receive 1 extra harvest.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_refreshingtouch_DisplayDescrip: When healing a teammate with a medical item, they also gain +5 hydration. This effect does not occur when healing yourself.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_brinkofdeath_DisplayDescriptio: When reviving a teammate that would otherwise be on "Last Legs" instead grant them "Extra Down" which gives them one additional chance instead of dying outright.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_aftercare_DisplayDescription: When reviving teammates they get a short healing buff and if reviving a teammate with a healing item the healing is increased by 20%.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_beautifulblueprints_DisplayDes: When sharing recipes with others, they don't have to complete the research phase.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_nerdrage_DisplayDescription: When surrounded by 2 or more enemies, if you receive a bleed you gain the Nerd Rage buff for 10 seconds. Your melee attacks are 25% faster but cost additional stamina (even if the weapon normally doesn't cost stamina)
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_smash_DisplayDescription: When using a blunt melee weapon, you have a chance to instantly explode enemies that are human-sized and smaller. Chance increases based on Strength level.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_redshift_DisplayDescription: While sprinting, enemies are more likely to miss when targeting you.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_photosynthetic_DisplayDescript: While within 15 meters of garden plants, their grow 10% faster (and consume water 10% faster too.) (Does not stack with multiple players)
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_combatdoc_DisplayDescription: You apply all medical items to yourself and to others twice as fast.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_basicgeometry_DisplayDescripti: You are less clumsy at reloading all weaponry.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_heavymeleeweapon_DisplayDescri: You are strong enough to properly wield heavy melee weapons.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_craftingbenchupgrade_t3_Displa: You can access the final tier of Crafting Bench upgrades.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_craftingbenchupgrade_DisplayDe: You can access the first tier of Crafting Bench upgrades.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_craftingbenchupgrade_t2_Displa: You can access the second tier of Crafting Bench upgrades.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_soupsmith_DisplayDescription: You can cook soups by filling a pot with water and adding ingredients.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_toss_DisplayDescription: You can do a gentle, underhand toss with all throwable items.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_bluntmeleewindup_DisplayDescri: You can do heavy windup attacks with blunt melee weapons. These attacks can not be performed with a shield.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_packyourdesk_DisplayDescriptio: You can package small deployables twice as fast.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_justincase_DisplayDescription: You can reload weapons you aren't otherwise qualified to use.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_bedsidemanner_DisplayDescripti: You can see all negative medical debuffs when up close to another player.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_throwcooktimer_DisplayDescript: You can see exactly how much time you have to cook an explosive before throwing it.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_motherknowsbest_DisplayDescrip: You can see other players' hunger and thirst when close by.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_throwingarc_DisplayDescription: You can see the predicted path of your throwable items before throwing them.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_stepaside_DisplayDescription: You can shake Vending Machines & stomp Carbuncles in 1 hit.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_sharpmeleethrow_DisplayDescrip: You can throw sharp melee weapons.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_heavyarmor_DisplayDescription: You can wear any weight of armor without dropping into the heaviest weight class.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_ammocrafter_DisplayDescription: You craft ammo twice as fast.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_nimble_DisplayDescription: You don't trigger Tripwires, Tripwire Lasers, or Carbuncles, even when not crouching.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_fertilizer_t1_DisplayDescripti: You gain a recipe for Anomalous Compost, aiding in the growth of your plants.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_fertilizer_t2_DisplayDescripti: You gain a recipe for Anomalous Fertilizer, aiding greatly in the growth of your plants.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_fertilizer_t3_DisplayDescripti: You gain a recipe for Anomalous Plant Food, aiding immensely in the growth of your plants.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_armwrapsT2_DisplayDescription: You gain the advanced Biomimic Armwraps recipe, allowing the use of more advanced firearms.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_milspec_DisplayDescription: You gain the confidence to properly handle more advanced firearms. You also learn the Biometric Armwraps recipe.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_cleancutter_DisplayDescription: You have a 25% higher chance to not end up with Bio Scrap when cutting up bodies.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_athletic_DisplayDescription: You have a chance to not lose stamina for an action that would normally use stamina.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_instantkill_DisplayDescription: You have a very small chance to instantly kill small and medium-sized enemies.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_spongey_DisplayDescription: You have slightly reduced fall damage and take less damage from environmental physics, such as vehicles.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_shadow_DisplayDescription: You move 15% faster when crouching and can perform a roll by sprinting while crouched.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_hearty_DisplayDescription: You regain extra health every time your health regenerates. You also learn the recipe for the Oven and Raw Dough.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_habit_DisplayDescription: You regenerate health a bit more frequently.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_finedining_DisplayDescription: You're making the best of a bad situation. You unlock the recipe for Dinner Placement, a rather exquisite meal.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_powerhungry_DisplayDescription: Your Power Attacks use 50% less stamina per swing.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_interdimensional_DisplayDescri: Your extended universe-hopping has enhanced your strong sneaking abilities. Enemy attacks just sometimes... miss?
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_nightworker_DisplayDescription: Your footsteps are much quieter and your chance to get a Sneak Attack is increased 50% at night.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_sliceanddice_DisplayDescriptio: Your sharp attacks have a higher chance to cause Severe Bleeding to the target.

DT_TextureVariants.poster_0091_ItemDescriptionOverride: A notice poster from the GATE Cascade Research Facility.
DT_TextureVariants.photoframe_zig_ItemDescriptionOverride: A picture of a happy dog.
DT_TextureVariants.poster_USM_ItemDescriptionOverride: A poster featuring a game of deception, comedy, and space corporatocracy.
DT_TextureVariants.poster_TDL_ItemDescriptionOverride: A poster featuring the (metaphorical) corpse of an apocalyptic survival game.
DT_TextureVariants.poster_Detour_ItemDescriptionOverride: A poster from an obscure, poorly-written arcade game.
DT_TextureVariants.painting_a_2_ItemFlavorTextOverride: A small "H.F." is scrawled hastily in the corner.
DT_TextureVariants.painting_a_3_ItemFlavorTextOverride: A small "H.F." is scrawled hastily in the corner.
DT_TextureVariants.painting_a_4_ItemFlavorTextOverride: A small "H.F." is scrawled hastily in the corner.
DT_TextureVariants.painting_a_5_ItemFlavorTextOverride: A small "H.F." is scrawled hastily in the corner.
DT_TextureVariants.painting_V_medieval_01_ItemFlavorTextOve: An older Italian painting. It looks genuine, but it's probably a reproduction.
DT_TextureVariants.poster_USM_ItemFlavorTextOverride: Remember: Space doesn't care about your feelings, but The Company does.

DT_Traits.Trait_Outdoorsman_TraitDescription: When not deep underground, you like to be out in the wild. You’re affected less by temperature changes.
DT_Traits.Trait_Feeble_TraitDescription: You are an exceptionally frail individual. You have 25% lower maximum health and break your bones more frequently from falls and blunt trauma.
DT_Traits.Trait_Inconspicuous_TraitDescription: You are meek and quiet. You attract enemy attention twice as slow as others.
DT_Traits.Trait_Dry_TraitDescription: You are naturally dry, getting thirsty 20% faster than others.
DT_Traits.Trait_Moist_TraitDescription: You are naturally moist and get thirsty 20% slower than others.
DT_Traits.Trait_Hemophilia_TraitDescription: You are twice as likely to bleed from a wound, and potentially quite severely.
DT_Traits.Trait_Strong_TraitDescription: You can carry 15% more weight than other scientists.
DT_Traits.Trait_LeadBelly_TraitDescription: You can drink tainted water without getting sick. Gross.
DT_Traits.Trait_SteelBladder_TraitDescription: You can hold it for quite some time. Your toilet needs are reduced by 20%.
DT_Traits.Trait_WeakBladder_TraitDescription: You can't hold it very long. Your toilet needs are increased by 15%, and you have to sit on the toilet for a longer duration than others.
DT_Traits.Trait_Cannibal_TraitDescription: You crave human flesh. It's the only thing keeping you sane.
DT_Traits.Trait_NightOwl_TraitDescription: You frequently work late into the night, becoming fatigued 50% slower than the average scientist.
DT_Traits.Trait_Gardener_TraitDescription: You gain Agriculture-related experience twice as fast and receive recipes for basic garden plots right from the outset.
DT_Traits.Trait_Narcoleptic_TraitDescription: You grow fatigued 75% faster than others and never feel truly rested. This affliction is a constant part of your life.
DT_Traits.Trait_ThickSkinned_TraitDescription: You have a 50% lower chance of receiving bleeding injuries.
DT_Traits.Trait_Chef_TraitDescription: You have a love of cooking. You gain Cooking skill twice as fast.
DT_Traits.Trait_HeartyAppetite_TraitDescription: You have a wild metabolism. You get hungry 60% faster than others.
DT_Traits.Trait_WrinklyBrainmeat_TraitDescription: You have more pliable neurological pathways. You gain 20% more XP than normal.
DT_Traits.Trait_SlowLearner_TraitDescription: You have very stiff neurological pathways. You learn skills 20% slower than normal and can't learn recipes via sharing nor by picking up things others have crafted.
DT_Traits.Trait_EasilyStartled_TraitDescription: You lose sanity 20% faster than normal.
DT_Traits.Trait_Asthmatic_TraitDescription: You lose stamina 40% faster than others.
DT_Traits.Trait_FannyPack_TraitDescription: You never leave home without it. You permanently gain 2 extra Hotbar Slots.
DT_Traits.Trait_FearOfViolence_TraitDescription: You refuse to engage with most combat-related skill past Level 5. (Accuracy, Reloading, Blunt Melee, Sharp Melee, Throwing)
DT_Traits.Trait_LightEater_TraitDescription: You require 20% less food than others do.
DT_Traits.Trait_Conspicuous_TraitDescription: You stand out, to your detriment. You attract enemy attention 45% faster than others.
DT_Traits.Trait_FirstAidCert_TraitDescription: You took the GATE-provided First Aid Certification course. You start with 5 bandages.
DT_Traits.Trait_SelfDefense_TraitDescription: You took the GATE-provided self-defense course. You deal +3 damage with all melee weapons.
DT_Traits.Trait_Decathlon_TraitDescription: You trained for and participated in the GATE Foundation Decathlon. You gain all fitness-related skills at a faster rate. (Sprinting, Strength, Throwing)
DT_Traits.Trait_FormerGuard_TraitDescription: You're a bit more stalwart than most. You lose sanity at a 50% slower rate.
DT_Traits.Trait_SlowHealer_TraitDescription: Your healing interval is 1.5 seconds slower than everyone else.

DT_TutorialHints.Tutorial_Emote_HintLongText: Hold to open the emote wheel and wave or page to the guard.
DT_TutorialHints.Tutorial_Journal_HintLongText: Open your Journal to view your current objective and notes.
DT_TutorialHints.Tutorial_Inventory_HintLongText: Pick up hard hat, then open your inventory to equip it.
DT_TutorialHints.Tutorial_InvincibleEnemies_HintLongText: Some entities can not be killed by your weaponry and should be avoided at all costs.
DT_TutorialHints.Tutorial_LookAround_HintLongText: Take a look around, if you want to.
DT_TutorialHints.Tutorial_Crouch_HintLongText: You can crouch to access vents and sneak about.
DT_TutorialHints.Tutorial_DismantlePipes_HintLongText: You can dismantle certain objects in order to find more crafting supplies.
DT_TutorialHints.Tutorial_ExitVehicle_HintLongText: You can exit vehicles and chairs by pressing Jump.
DT_TutorialHints.Tutorial_Jump_HintLongText: You can jump over small obstacles.
DT_TutorialHints.Tutorial_Sneaking_HintLongText: You can sneak past certain enemies, or you can tackle them head on.
DT_TutorialHints.Tutorial_MakeNets_HintLongText: You may want to craft some Throw Nets for self-defense.

DT_TutorialPanelTips.Tip_Crafting_Description: As a scientist, you find inspiration all around you! Gain new crafting Recipes and Ideas by picking up resources, interacting with items, packaging furniture, and the occasional email. Press 'C' to access your CRAFTING & RESEARCH menu. Some Recipes are craftable right away, but Ideas must first be invented. You’ve learned the Recipe for THROW NETS - now craft some!
DT_TutorialPanelTips.Tip_Dismantling_Description: Many objects can be dismantled for resources - either broken with a proper weapon, or taken apart by holding F. Vents can be destroyed or dismantled.
DT_TutorialPanelTips.Tip_Movement_Description: Use W, A, S, D to move about. Use Left SHIFT to sprint.
DT_TutorialPanelTips.Tip_Radiation_Description: When you encounter RADIATION, you will see small speckles or dots in your vision, increasing in intensity with the radiation strength. A little won't hurt, but long-term exposure will harm you without protection.
DT_TutorialPanelTips.Tip_PortalWorlds_Description: You’re about to venture out of the Facility for a while. You’ll be able to return through a return portal, but you may want to do a little preparation, like bringing some food and ensuring you’re well rested. If you die in a portal world, you can choose to respawn at the Portal World entrance, or at another spawn point in the Facility.

DT_UIPopups.equipbackpack_PopupText: Equip the backpack by dragging it into your Backpack slot.
DT_UIPopups.equiphardhat_PopupText: Equip the hard hat by dragging it into your Head slot.
DT_UIPopups.weight_PopupText: If you are carrying too much, it will affect your movement speed.
DT_UIPopups.traitscreen_PopupText: Select Positive and Negative traits for your character. Negative traits will add some challenges, but will give more points to spend on Positive traits.
DT_UIPopups.jobscreen_PopupText: Select a Job from the list.
DT_UIPopups.research_brain_PopupText: THINK: Click the brain to check if the item recipe is a logical solution. You only have to do this once to learn an item's recipe.
DT_UIPopups.medical_PopupText: You can quickly use available health items by accessing your doctor bag. Your doctor bag can also be accessed by holding the Health Screen key.
DT_UIPopups.benchupgrades_PopupText: You can upgrade your Crafting Bench if you have the right materials.
DT_UIPopups.newperk_PopupText: You leveled up a Skill! This has granted you a new Perk! You can view these in your Stats Screen.
DT_UIPopups.journalnotes_PopupText: Your journal notes are stored by location. Click on a location icon to view notes for that location.

DT_VideoSettings.Resolution_DisplayDescription: Adjust the pixel dimensions of the game. This should typically match your monitor resolution.
DT_VideoSettings.WindowMode_DisplayDescription: Selected which window mode you want the game to run in. Fullscreen will give the best performance, but may be more uncomfortable with dual-monitor setups.
DT_VideoSettings.MaxFPS_DisplayDescription: This value will force the game to run at a specific locked framerate. Lower locked framerate may help with performance.
DT_VideoSettings.ViewDistance_DisplayDescription: This will adjust how close to the camera objects will hide or lower their level of detail.
DT_VideoSettings.PostProcessing_DisplayDescription: This will adjust how detailed certain post-process effects appear. The quality of refraction and particles may be affected.
DT_VideoSettings.AntiAliasing_DisplayDescription: This will adjust how sharp, jagged or blurry edges of objects appear. Lower values or off will increase performance but create a rougher look.
DT_VideoSettings.Gamma_DisplayDescription: This will adjust the overall brightness of the game, but brighter values may wash out the intended look.
DT_VideoSettings.Textures_DisplayDescription: This will adjust the quality of textures. Higher values may use more video memory, and lower vcalues will reduce that useage.
DT_VideoSettings.ResolutionScale_DisplayDescription: This will adjust the rendering scale of the game. Lowering this will make things appear more pixelated but may boost performance.
DT_VideoSettings.Foliage_DisplayDescription: This will affect the detail of foliage in the scene, when you manage to find the one patch of grass in the entire underground Facility.
DT_VideoSettings.Bloom_DisplayDescription: This will determine how much bloom is around bright light sources. If you prefer less bloom, turning this down may also darken the scene a bit.
DT_VideoSettings.Reflections_DisplayDescription: This will determine the quality of reflective surfaces in the world.
DT_VideoSettings.Shadows_DisplayDescription: This will determine the quality of shadows present in the world. Lowering this will help performance, but may cause the scene to look brighter than desired.
DT_VideoSettings.Effects_DisplayDescription: This will effect the quality of particles and some other details in the scene.
DT_VideoSettings.GlobalIllumination_DisplayDescription: This will greatly affect the quality of lighting. Setting this too low will completely remove shadows and lighting and is not recommended, but may increase performance.
DT_VideoSettings.VerticalSync_DisplayDescription: This will lock the game to the refresh rate of your monitor. If you experience screen-tearing, this may correct that issue.

ItemTable_Craftables.bridge_t1_ItemDescription: A bridge made of wood, used for traversing pits big and small, with enough structural support.

ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Fridge_ItemFlavorText: Is this thing made of lead?! It's not, obviously, but it sure feels like it. In fact, the heaviest aspect of a refrigerator is the compressor and housing to the fridge itself. The insulation is somewhat heavy as well, but that hardly registers in terms of the sheer back-breaking weight of everything else it's comprised of. Either way, the gravity of this object is sure to weigh on you for quite some time.

ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pestpotato_burnt_ItemDescription: A combination of pest and potato, burned to a crisp.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_peccary_chop_cooked_ItemDescription: A cooked chunk of Peccary meat.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_greyebchowder_ItemDescription: A creamy chowder with potato chunks and what appears to be eyeballs.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_hash_ItemDescription: A delicious assemblage of space eggs, weird sausage, and dubious cheese.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_exorheart_burnt_ItemDescription: A destroyed heart of an Exor.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_donut_ItemDescription: A donut in a nice little package.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_roastpecc_ItemDescription: A flavorful hunk of well-cooked xeno-quadruped stuffed with delights.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_sweetporridge_raw_ItemDescription: A giant leap for porridge, probably.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pestpotpie_slice_ItemDescription: A hearty serving of Pest Pot Pie.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.coffee_ItemDescription: A highly caffeinated drink. Sure to knock some fatigue off, but may have other side-effects.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.coffee_cold_ItemDescription: A highly caffeinated drink. Sure to knock some fatigue off, but not much else.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_uncooked_lethal_ItemDescription: A killer concoction in the making.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_carbcasserole_raw_ItemDescription: A melange of offworld meat, mushrooms, cheese and the humble potato, ready for the oven.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_peccary_sausages_ItemDescription: A mix of Peccary meat-filled bags.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_peccary_sausages_cooked_ItemDescrip: A mix of Peccary meat-filled bags.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_mushroom_ItemDescription: A mushroom shed by a fungally-festooned variant of IS-0178.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_peccary_chop_burnt_ItemDescription: A pecarry chop, burnt to a crisp.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pestpie_slice_ItemDescription: A pest pie in a nice little package.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_meatpie_ItemDescription: A pest-rich pie with a smattering of eyeballs.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_cheesewheel_ItemDescription: A pot of cheese curds, soon on their whey to being aged into bona fide cheese.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_cheesewheel_raw_ItemDescription: A pot of coagulating alien milk, awaiting gentle cooking.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_solder_ItemDescription: A pot of melted metal and silver, creating a fuseable alloy.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_solder_raw_ItemDescription: A pot of partway melted metal and silver.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_glue_raw_ItemDescription: A pot of something capable of melting into useable glue.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_pea_raw_ItemDescription: A pot on its way to becoming something filling, but relatively mundane.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_pea_split_raw_ItemDescription: A pot on its way to becoming something filling.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_roastpecc_raw_ItemDescription: A raw confection of otherworldly meats, fungus and peas.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_peccmush_raw_ItemDescription: A raw stew in the making.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_creamytomato_raw_ItemDescription: A raw tomato soup of sorts.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_englishbreakfast_raw_ItemDescriptio: A raw, but interesting take on a classic sausage-egg combo.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_creamytomato_ItemDescription: A saucy, creamy spin on a classic.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_carbcasserole_slice_ItemDescription: A serving of casserole unlike any the world has seen before.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_pest_tail_ItemFlavorText: A set of large muscles between far too much cartilage.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cake_slice_ItemDescription: A slice of cake as appetizing as it is unlikely.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_hash_slice_ItemDescription: A slice of delicious brekkie hash.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pizza_carb_slice_ItemDescription: A slice of something like pizza.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cheesepuffs_ItemDescription: A small bag of cheese puffs.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_cooked_random_ItemDescription: A soup made from various bits... Not very filling, and not very good. There's a chance you may become ill from consuming this.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_pestgoulash_raw_ItemDescription: A stew of pest awaiting only the stovetop's heat.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_meatystew_ItemDescription: A stew, unlike many before it.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soda_anom_ItemDescription: A strange soda, from a strange vending machine.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pestpotato_ItemDescription: A surprisingly edible amalgam of pest and potato.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_anteburger_ItemDescription: A tasty, plump burger assembled from otherwordly delectables.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_bread_ItemDescription: A toasty bread made from wheat. Or something like wheat, anyway.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cookies_gum_burnt_ItemDescription: A tray of terribly burned cookies.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_bakedpotato_burnt_ItemDescription: A tuber baked for too long.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pestpie_burnt_ItemDescription: A very burnt Simple Pest Pie.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cookie_ItemDescription: A well-preserved sugar cookie in a plastic bag.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cheesewheel_raw_ItemDescription: A wheel of alien cheese that needs some time before it's ready.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_milksac_ItemDescription: A yeasty milky substance inside a kind of amniotic sac. Potentially useable in cooking.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_armandleg_raw_ItemDescription: All the raw goodness of limbs and organs.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_eggplant_burnt_ItemDescription: An "Egg" that has been very fried.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_roastpecc_burnt_ItemDescription: An Alien Drumstick that's been cooked for far too long.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pestpotato_raw_ItemDescription: An experimental amalgam of invasive pest and potato.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_PestPotPie_raw_ItemFlavorText: An improvement on the Simple Pest Pie recipe, for more accomplished makers of otherworldly baked goods.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_meatpie_raw_ItemDescription: An oven-ready pie rich in sustenance.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_peccary_chop_ItemDescription: An uncooked chunk of Peccary meat.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_PestPotPie_raw_ItemDescription: An uncooked pie, yet rich in pestly goodness.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_mre_raw_ItemDescription: An uncooked soup to sustain survivors.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_tomato_super_ItemDescription: As magnificent as it is purple, a giant, juicy wonder of science.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_eggplant_raw_ItemFlavorText: As perfect, mysterious and marmoreal as its namesake.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cookie_ItemFlavorText: At least it can't go bad.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_tomato_ItemFlavorText: Bet you didn't know was a fruit. Look it up in an encyclopedia.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_sandwich_cheese_ItemDescription: Conforming to some definitions of a cheese sandwich.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_donut_ItemFlavorText: Contrary to assumption, GATE security is known to avoid vending machines.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_carbuncle_carcass_burnt_ItemFlavorT: Crunchy! But for the wrong reason.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_fries_burnt_ItemDescription: Fries that have been baked for far too long.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_greyeb_ItemFlavorText: GATE scientists never quite see eye to eye on whether the Greyeb tastes sweet or savory.  It seems to vary from person to person.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_eggplant_ItemFlavorText: In years to come, scientists and philosophers may argue about whether this is 'really' an egg. But right now, it's looking pretty good.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_armandleg_ItemDescription: It cost something an arm and a leg.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_hash_burnt_ItemFlavorText: It hash been cooked for too long...
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soda_e_ItemDescription: It vaguely tastes like berry, and you're not really sure which kind.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pizza_carb_raw_ItemDescription: It's a pizza, probably better cooked.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_pea_split_ItemDescription: It's a soup with peas in it, and something else.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_pea_ItemDescription: It's a soup with peas in it.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cookies_gum_burnt_ItemFlavorText: It's enough to make a GATE scientist cry.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cookies_gum_ItemFlavorText: It's more than a cookie, it's a monument to humanity's refusal to perish in the darkness without a murmur.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soda_c_ItemFlavorText: Like a bearhug in your mouth.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_greyebchowder_raw_ItemFlavorText: Like so many chowders before it, a dish that hopefully tastes better than it looks.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_heartystew_ItemDescription: Many ingredients were cooked together, qualifying this as a stew.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_mre_ItemDescription: Military standard-issue meal ready to eat.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pizza_carb_burnt_ItemDescription: More char than there is pizza.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cheesewheel_raw_ItemFlavorText: Now you just gotta brie patient.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_veggiestew_raw_ItemDescription: Once cooked, this should be a healthful veggie stew.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_pasta_homey_raw_ItemDescription: Pasta from beyond tastes better cooked.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_PestPotPie_ItemFlavorText: Peas, pests, potatoes - who could resist this most nourishing of pies?
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_hash_burnt_ItemDescription: Pekkie Brekkie Hash that is very, very burnt.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_PestPotPie_ItemDescription: Pest pie packed with potato and peas - perfection.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_hash_raw_ItemDescription: Raw eggs, cheese, sausage and potato, kinda.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_englishbreakfast_ItemDescription: Sausage and eggs are a classic, no matter their origin.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_rotten_ItemDescription: Some very expired food, probably left uneaten for too long.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cheese_ItemFlavorText: Someone had time to make cheese, but not ask certain ontological questions.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.coffee_cold_ItemFlavorText: Someone left it alone a bit too long.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_uncooked_random_ItemDescription: Soup is a strong word for this mixture of water and... whatever else someone threw in here.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_peccary_leg_ItemFlavorText: Still has a bit of hoof in it.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_candy_ItemFlavorText: Sugar is a major food group, right?
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pizza_carb_raw_ItemFlavorText: Thankfully, the standards for what counts as a pizza have been widened lately.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_exor_arm_ItemDescription: The arm of an extraordinary Exor.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_sandwich_toastie_burnt_ItemDescript: The charred remains of an Antecheese Toastie.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_peccary_leg_cooked_ItemDescription: The cooked leg of an alien lifeform.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cake_ItemFlavorText: The fact that someone managed to bake this is an achievement that ennobles the entire human race.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_greyeb_ItemDescription: The fruit seems to emit trace amounts of electromagnetic radiation. It’s not enough to be harmful, but might attract unwanted attention.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_symph_skull_ItemDescription: The head of a menacing fog entity.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_peccmush_ItemFlavorText: The most shocking thing about this is how bad it isn't.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_peccary_skull_red_ItemDescription: The skull of a felled Peccary Alpha.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_tarasque_skull_ItemDescription: The skull of a felled Tarasque.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_sow_skull_ItemDescription: The skull of a slain Peccary Sow.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_pecmushroom_skull_ItemDescription: The skull of a slain Peccary with a peculiar fungal affliction.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_peccary_skull_ItemDescription: The skull of a slain Peccary.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_exorheart_cooked_ItemDescription: The slightly cooked heart of an Exor.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_greyebchowder_ItemFlavorText: The taste better be worth it.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pest_tail_burnt_ItemDescription: The torched rump of a Pest.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_pest_body_ItemDescription: The uncooked head of a Pest.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_exorheart_ItemDescription: The uncooked heart of an Exor.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_peccary_leg_ItemDescription: The uncooked leg of an alien lifeform.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_pest_tail_ItemDescription: The uncooked rump of a Pest.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_peccary_leg_burnt_ItemDescription: The way over-cooked leg of an alien lifeform.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soda_d_ItemDescription: There's nothing funny about the Fizz.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cookies_gum_raw_ItemDescription: These cookies show promise, even uncooked.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_human_skull_ItemFlavorText: They probably don't need it anymore.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_uncooked_toxic_ItemDescription: This is an uncooked mess of things that ought not be eaten.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soda_c_ItemDescription: This soda tastes like licorice, or something worse.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.icecream_melted_ItemDescription: This was once a happy treat, and is now a sad slop.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cheesepuffs_ItemFlavorText: Those farm-to-table cheese puffs, just like Mama used to make.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_mashedpotatoes_raw_ItemDescription: Uncooked, but promising a taste of home.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_potatosausage_ItemDescription: What it says on the can.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_potatosausage_raw_ItemDescription: What it says on the can.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_poop_ItemDescription: What on earth are you thinking?!
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_carbdumplings_raw_ItemDescription: When cooked, this may actually be edible.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_meatpie_slice_ItemFlavorText: Whoever concocted this pie felt the need to feed their friends, and was willing to stop at nothing.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_sugarslop_raw_ItemDescription: Wih care this may turn into barely acceptable slop.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_lethal_ItemDescription: You do NOT want to drink this.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_toxic_ItemDescription: You do not want to drink this.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pestpotato_raw_ItemFlavorText: You're the one who made it.

ItemTable_Gear.trinket_nightpass_ItemDescription: A GATE-authorized pass, handy for safely traveling the halls of the Facility during after-hours.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_security_ItemDescription: A backpack worn by the GATE Defense Team.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_beret_ItemDescription: A beret worn by what appear to be the squad leaders. It features some sort of rune on the front.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_cushions_ItemDescription: A big chestplate made from cloth, tape and stuffing.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_labs_ItemDescription: A chitinous set of arm protectors, built from slain beasts and bit of scientific engineering.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_medmask_ItemDescription: A cloth medical mask usually worn by doctors.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_geigercounter_ItemDescription: A compact device that detects radiation in the immediate area.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_hardhat_ItemDescription: A durable helmet to protect warehouse workers.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_carbuncle_ItemDescription: A fancy hat cobbled accordingly from the carcass of a contemptible carbuncle.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_santahat_ItemDescription: A festive hat from a jolly man who has no respect for the laws of physics.
ItemTable_Gear.suit_ratsuit_ItemDescription: A hazardous environment suit adorned with odd markings. Greatly reduces radiation buildup.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_bunnyears_ItemDescription: A headband for a time of year whose celebration is completely optional at all GATE facilities except for Springer.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_leadvest_t2_ItemDescription: A heavy laboratory vest used to block harmful radiation.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_leadvest_ItemDescription: A heavy lead vest typically used to block harmful x-rays.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_peccary_ItemDescription: A helmet made from a cantankerous creature.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_pecc_alpha_ItemDescription: A helmet made from a rare, red Peccary.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_mushroom_ItemDescription: A helmet made from the head of a fungal fiend.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_sow_ItemDescription: A helmet made from the head of a purple Peccary.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_tarasque_ItemDescription: A helmet made from the head of an enormous microbe.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_breacher_ItemDescription: A helmet of military make, adorned with strange markings and iron bars laid across the face shield.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_military_ItemDescription: A helmet of military make, adorned with strange markings.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_composer_ItemDescription: A helmet sewn together from paper and padding, with the melodius qualities of a cardboard box.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_foglantern_ItemDescription: A humming lantern that seems to react when in the presence of lingering water vapor.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_large_ItemDescription: A large research pack, for transporting samples from other worlds.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_rat_ItemDescription: A large, heavy pack that does absolutely nothing for its wearer's spine or posture.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_medic_ItemDescription: A medic helmet of military make, adorned with strange markings.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_radio_ItemDescription: A military backpack with some electronics attached.
ItemTable_Gear.headlamp_default_ItemDescription: A mounted headlamp capable of deftly replacing any handheld flashlight.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_petrock_ItemDescription: A painted rock with googly eyes.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_composer_ItemDescription: A scrappy leg armor made from pieces of much taller beings.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_light_white_ItemDescription: A small anomalous gem that constantly emits a white light.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_light_purple_ItemDescription: A small crystalline shard that emits an odd purple light.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_spuddy_ItemDescription: A small potato with a chain on it.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_light_orange_ItemDescription: A small tube that emits a comfy orange glow.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_labs_ItemDescription: A strong chestplate built from the shells of insects and a few other things.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_weldingmask_ItemDescription: A strong helmet to prevent welders from receiving injuries.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_labs_ItemDescription: A study helmet built from some lab equipment and alien carapace.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_composer_ItemDescription: A sturdy porcelain clad these arm wrappings.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_order_ItemDescription: A symbol worn by the most fanatical members of The Order, keepers of the oldest traditions.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_apron_leather_ItemDescriptio: A very heavy apron used by blacksmiths.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_makeshift_ItemDescription: A very small backpack made from cloth scraps.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_gasmask_ItemDescription: An airtight mask often used by those working with dangerous chemicals.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_security_starter_ItemDescrip: An armored vest worn by the GATE Defense Team.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_hat_egg_ItemDescription: An oval hat no doubt created by a scientist who has truly lost their marbles.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_gravitycube_ItemDescription: An unusual cube that makes people feel a little lighter than normal...
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_apron_leather_ItemFlavorText: Apparently blacksmiths still exist. Who knew?
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_composer_ItemDescription: Chest protection made to mimic the inhabitants of Anteverse I, with a few creative liberties.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_bionic_ItemDescription: Cobbled together by ingenuity, and a bit of hope, these legs will allow the wearer to move faster and land harder.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_highvisvest_ItemDescription: For those who like being seen.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_labs_ItemDescription: Leg protection built from the backs of many foes with some laboratory scrap holding it all together.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_apron_ItemFlavorText: Let's shed some light on the subject.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_gloves_purple_ItemDescription: Long purple gloves, typically worn by those handling precious objects.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_karate_ItemDescription: Makes getting punched in the head suck slightly less.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_tarasque_ItemFlavorText: Nothing that small should ever be this big.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_rat_ItemFlavorText: Once stuffed with scrap and supplies pilfered from the Facility, returning it to its former state is the goal of any good Rat.
ItemTable_Gear.suit_ratsuit_ItemFlavorText: Ostensibly, these "Lab Rats" are known to be as meticulous as they are unhinged. Combining deep science with utter devotion to the cause, this path has led the Rats to a field of science that may not even exist.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_gloves_garden_ItemDescription: Rough green gloves, typically worn by gardeners and those working with thorny plants.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_gloves_lab_ItemDescription: Sleek white gloves, typically worn by lab workers.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_hat_securitycap_ItemDescription: Standard-issue cap worn by the GATE Defense Team.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_bionic_ItemFlavorText: Stronger. Faster. Eh, you know the rest.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_gloves_work_ItemDescription: Sturdy gloves typically worn by construction workers.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_breacher_ItemFlavorText: The Breachers are paying penance, deployed on the front lines with a constant reminder of their guilt.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_chefhat_ItemDescription: The hallmark of a true chef.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_biometric_ItemDescription: These armwraps don't provide much armor, but they do allow the wearer to operate certain weapons.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_biometric_t2_ItemDescription: These armwraps don't provide much armor, but they do allow the wearer to operate special weapons.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_leadvest_ItemFlavorText: This could work as armor... For now.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_blacksmithinggloves_ItemDescr: Very heavy gloves, typically worn by metalworkers.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_chefhat_ItemFlavorText: Well, you LOOK like you can cook, anyway.
ItemTable_Gear.suit_hazmat_ItemDescription: Worn by scientists to study radiation and biohazardous materials. Greatly reduces radiation buildup.
ItemTable_Gear.suit_fire_ItemDescription: Worn by volcano researchers and molten manufacturing workers. Blocks most exposure to high heat and flame.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_carbuncle_ItemFlavorText: You are king of the carbuncles. Which... doesn't really mean much.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_scarbuncle_ItemFlavorText: You are queen of the carbuncles. Which... doesn't really mean much.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_hat_egg_ItemFlavorText: You know what you are, why not embrace it?
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_composer_ItemFlavorText: Your arms feel lighter, almost as if they're being suspended by strings.

ItemTable_Pickups.soilbag_ItemDescription: A bag of healthy, fertile soil.
ItemTable_Pickups.scrap_plastic_ItemDescription: A bag of plastic odds and ends.
ItemTable_Pickups.rubberbands_ItemDescription: A ball of rubber bands. Someone spent a lot of time making this.
ItemTable_Pickups.bandage_ItemDescription: A basic bandage that will stop one instance of bleeding. Does NOT restore health.
ItemTable_Pickups.stapler_ItemDescription: A basic office stapler. Contains springs.
ItemTable_Pickups.woodplank_ItemDescription: A basic piece of wood, used in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.gravitycube_ItemDescription: A blue, anomalous cube. It appears to affect the gravity of anyone holding it.
ItemTable_Pickups.screws_ItemDescription: A box of screws, useable in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.salt_ItemDescription: A bunch of sodium, useable in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.pens_ItemDescription: A bundle of office pens. You can think of a few clever ways to utilize these.
ItemTable_Pickups.scrap_military_ItemDescription: A bundle of random military-grade electronics. Nothing too helpful by itself.
ItemTable_Pickups.oil_ItemDescription: A can of petroleum-based oil. Used for repair and crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.batterycharger_ItemDescription: A charging kit for regular car batteries. Perhaps it can be repurposed...
ItemTable_Pickups.gigaglue_ItemDescription: A common adhesive used to bind things together.
ItemTable_Pickups.casefan_ItemDescription: A computer case fan, used in crafting advanced electronics.
ItemTable_Pickups.circuitboard_ItemDescription: A computer circuit board, used in crafting advanced electronics.
ItemTable_Pickups.harddrive_ItemDescription: A computer hard drive, used in crafting advanced electronics.
ItemTable_Pickups.powersupply_ItemDescription: A computer power supply unit, used in crafting advanced electronics.
ItemTable_Pickups.coil_ItemDescription: A copper coiling, useable in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.burner_ItemDescription: A device used for heating up chemicals. Useable in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.ammo_disc_ItemDescription: A disc with a very sharp edge.
ItemTable_Pickups.fireextinguisher_ItemDescription: A fire extinguisher consisting of a compressed air can.
ItemTable_Pickups.gel_ItemDescription: A gel from the Anteverse with extremely unstable properties.
ItemTable_Pickups.beaker_ItemDescription: A glass tube used for experiments.
ItemTable_Pickups.geigercounter_ItemDescription: A hand-held radiation detector. Point it at yourself to check your own radiation level.
ItemTable_Pickups.scrap_tech_ItemDescription: A handful of random technological junk.
ItemTable_Pickups.lcd_screen_ItemDescription: A handy display for electronic devices.
ItemTable_Pickups.scrap_bio_ItemDescription: A heap of biological scrap. Might come in handy.
ItemTable_Pickups.capacitor_ItemDescription: A heavy device used for storing or discharging energy.
ItemTable_Pickups.anvil_ItemDescription: A heavy object, useful for acting as a giant paperweight. Might also be helpful in repairing stuff too, with the right additions.
ItemTable_Pickups.aircompressor_ItemDescription: A high pressure air transfer unit, might be useful for things that require copious amounts of air power.
ItemTable_Pickups.cpu_ItemDescription: A high-tech CPU, recovered from something extraordinary.
ItemTable_Pickups.cable_fibre_ItemDescription: A high-tech fibre optic cable, useable in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.diode_ItemDescription: A high-tech laser diode, used in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.key_security_ItemDescription: A high-tech security key clearly used to keep important things locked up tight.
ItemTable_Pickups.anomaly_ItemDescription: A indecipherable entity that appears to respond to glass and has a peculiar attraction to plant life.

StringTable_MenuText.menu_demonotice_fulltext:
Abiotic Factor is undergoing active development.

We hope you enjoy what we’re creating, and please leave feedback if you’d like by using the feedback or bug report buttons available in the menus.

We’re also collecting some anonymous gameplay data, such as what players craft and kill, and how long it takes to reach certain areas, in order to help us improve the game.

StringTable_MenuText.menu_serverbrowser_newscientist_desc:
We have detected that your profile is new to Abiotic Factor. Please consider carefully before joining random public servers as your first-time experience may differ wildly. We recommend new players play singleplayer or with friends for the first time, from the beginning of the game, in order to experience the story and progression as intended without spoilers or confusing unexplained mechanics.

That said, we trust you to make the right decision. That's why you work at GATE, after all.

You are about to perform a force respawn. This will count as a death, and your corpse will remain at this location. This will allow you to respawn at your last viable spawn point.

This is not recommended unless you're REALLY stuck! Please report stuck locations to the developers so they can be fixed.

Are you sure you want to perform a force respawn?

StringTable_MenuText.menu_jobselect: Your science skills will grow over time, but your chosen profession gives you an immediate skill advantage. Ask yourself: What kind of scientist are you? Hover over a job to learn more.

StringTable_Notices.newgame_positivenegativetraits_note:
Character Traits are what make you special and set you apart from your colleagues.

You can select POSITIVE and NEGATIVE traits. If you select NEGATIVE traits, you have more points to select on POSITIVE ones.

You have a limited number of points, so choose wisely!
StringTable_Notices.newgame_charactersaves_note:
In Abiotic Factor, your character is saved on a per-world basis. This means your character’s Traits, Skills, Items, Equipment and progress are tied to a given server.

Visual customization is stored locally and carried between servers.

You need to select a Job and starting Traits for your character with each new world, which you’ll do now.

StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_throwing: Each level increases how far you can throw objects of all kinds. XP is primarily gained by throwing weapons, grenades, throwable devices and even miscellaneous objects.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_agriculture: Each level increases how fast plants planted by you regrow once they're harvested. XP is primarily gained by planting, tending to and harvesting plants.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_construction: Each level increases how fast you construct with screwdrivers and how likely you are to keep furniture intact when packaging it. XP is primarily gained by constructing and deconstructing furniture.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_sneaking: Each level increases how long it takes enemies to detect your presence. XP is primarily gained by sneaking around dangerous, active enemies.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_firstaid: Each level increases how much extra health is regained when using medical items. XP is primarily gained by using and crafting medical items.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_crafting: Each level increases your crafting speed and gives you access to Bench Upgrades. XP is primarily gained by crafting and repairing items.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_bluntmelee: Each level increases your damage with blunt weaponry. XP is primarily gained by bashing enemies with blunt weaponry.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_sharpmelee: Each level increases your damage with sharp weapons. XP is primarily gained by slicing enemies with sharp weaponry.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_accuracy: Each level increases your overall accuracy, reduces recoil, and ranged weapon sway. XP is primarily gained by firing ranged weaponry.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_fortitude: Each level increases your overall health points, particularly that of your head, as well as reduces the damage you take. XP is primarily gained by taking damage from enemies, unfortunately.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_reloading: Each level increases your reload speed by a decent percentage and will eventually reduce how clumsy you are at reloading in general. XP is primarily gained by reloading weapons of all kinds.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_strength: Each level increases your total carrying capacity and eventually unlocks proper access to heavy weapons. XP is primarily gained by traveling with a heavy inventory.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_sprinting: Each level increases your total stamina by a small amount. XP is primarily gained by sprinting over long distances.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_cooking: Every 5 levels increases your total competence in cooking and ranking up gives you to new recipes. XP is primarily gained by cooking food, baking and making soups.

StringTable_Traits.PhD_NutritonalSci: A deep understanding of nutrition, physiology and biochemistry means you know how to look after yourself. There's no question: you get out what you put in. (Suggested role: Chef)
StringTable_Traits.PhD_HumanBio: For someone with two PhDs, you're surprisingly robust. You're quick and kinetically resilient, decently fit, and can take a few knocks. Your autonomic system is under control. (Suggested role: Defensive Combat)
StringTable_Traits.PhD_MechEng: It wasn't your looks or sparkling conversation that got you here, it was your impressive facility with fabrication and tooling. (Suggested role: Builder)
StringTable_Traits.PhD_Medicine: Research on live subjects has taught you everything about the human body, especially injuries, harm and ailments. Your medical abilities are considerably more advanced than your colleagues. (Suggested Role: Medic)
StringTable_Traits.PhD_Agriculture: You chose the lab over the farm, but never lost your touch with plants. You know biosciences, genetics, and how things grow - even GATE's most exotic specimens. (Suggested role: Gardener)
StringTable_Traits.PHDDesc_Intern: You haven't quite earned your PhD yet, and judging by the state of things, you're not going to any time soon. (Suggested Role: Blank Slate)
StringTable_Traits.PhDDesc_NoPhD: You're fresh, you're green, and probably in way over your head. But what you lack in skill, you make up for in sheer ambition, speed and staying out of everyone's crosshairs. (Suggested Role: Stealth)
StringTable_Traits.PhD_DefenseSecurity: You're one of the brightest officers on the Defense Team, and could've been a scientist yourself. There's a small rift between you and your egghead colleagues, but they respect your strategy. (Suggested Role: Offensive Combat)
StringTable_Traits.PhD_TheoreticalPhys: Your knowledge may be theoretical, but you know everything about how objects move through space, and spend a lot of time planning new gadgets and inventions. (Suggested Role: Throwing / Utility)
